item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, November 26, 2024 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Launch HN: Human Layer (YC F24) – Human-in-the-Loop API for AI Systems (209 points | 131 comments)
2. Teen mathematicians tie knots through a mind-blowing fractal (102 points | 15 comments)
3. FCC Grants SpaceX Right to Some Direct-to-Cellular Operations [pdf] (18 points | 2 comments)
4. A solution to The Onion problem of J. Kenji Lopez-Alt (2021) (249 points | 96 comments)
5. GenChess (87 points | 85 comments)
6. Hats Off to NASA's Webb: Sombrero Galaxy Dazzles in New Image (58 points | 14 comments)
7. We can mine asteroids for space food (107 points | 117 comments)
8. Show HN: SQLite Plugin for Jekyll (152 points | 51 comments)
9. LLVM-powered devirtualization (156 points | 4 comments)
10. Show HN: Silent Poems – Visual expression of unspoken thoughts (66 points | 20 comments)
11. The AI reporter that took my old job just got fired (214 points | 232 comments)
12. Setelinleikkaus: When Finns snipped their cash in half to curb inflation (183 points | 169 comments)
13. Henry James and H.G. Wells (1958) (45 points | 28 comments)
14. The industry structure of LLM makers (78 points | 74 comments)
15. ZetaOffice: LibreOffice in the Browser (10 points | 2 comments)
16. Remembering Cyberia, the first ever cyber cafe (83 points | 55 comments)
17. Git-crypt – transparent file encryption in Git (3 points | discuss)
18. Artificial Intelligence and the Future of Work (20 points | 8 comments)
19. A Short Introduction to Automotive Lidar Technology (236 points | 170 comments)
20. California's most neglected group of students: the gifted ones (279 points | 396 comments)
21. Y Combinator often backs startups that duplicate other YC companies, data shows (310 points | 153 comments)
22. Poisoning the Day (165 points | 69 comments)
23. Scientists are learning why ultra-processed foods are bad (143 points | 274 comments)
24. A Revolution in How Robots Learn (34 points | 7 comments)
25. DEA passenger searches halted after watchdog finds signs of rights violations (163 points | 154 comments)
26. Yes, it ‘looks like a duck,’ but carriers like the new USPS mail truck (94 points | 91 comments)
27. 'The Best of All Possible Worlds' Review: Leibniz Lives Again (75 points | 54 comments)
28. Tunable ultrasound propagation in microscale metamaterials (23 points | 4 comments)
29. Show HN: Gemini LLM corrects ASR YouTube transcripts (163 points | 101 comments)
30. A slave narrative resurfaces after nearly 170 years (110 points | 59 comments)
